supportUs.title: Support Us
supportUs.description: The income is used to help with everything — from food, clothing, education, supplies, healthcare, medicine, and dental care for children, as well as supporting the music school and paying our staff. The children's families are also included in the food program, receiving monthly food supplies and hygiene products. We continuously strive to improve the children's living conditions, and most of the remaining aid is used for housing repairs.

ourMission.title: Our Mission
ourMission.description: The income is used to cover everything — from food, clothing, education, supplies, healthcare, medicine, and dental care for children, as well as running the music school and paying our staff. The children's families are also included in the food program, receiving monthly food supplies and hygiene products. We continuously strive to improve the children's living conditions, and most of the remaining aid is used for housing repairs.

funding.title: Where does our funding come from?
funding.description: MMF is a small community-based organization primarily supported by private donors in Norway. Regular donors (MMF supporters) provide financial stability and reliability. Additionally, we are fortunate to have many enthusiastic people who raise funds during special occasions such as birthdays and events. Besides private donors, our biggest supporter is Musikk Gir Liv (musicians from the Kristiansand Orchestra), providing funding for the music school's operation and sound equipment. In the last two years, Musikk Gir Liv visited Antsirabe with a group of musicians from the orchestra, teaching music to MMF children and participating in performances alongside the students.

support.title: Thank you for your support!
support.description: The income is used to support everything — from food, clothing, education, supplies, healthcare, medicine, and dental care for children, as well as keeping the music school running and paying our staff. The children’s families are also included in the food program, receiving monthly food supplies and hygiene products. We continuously strive to improve the children's living conditions, and most of the remaining aid is used for housing repairs.

history._comment: History section - comment will be deleted later
history.title: The History of MMF
history.description: MMF was officially founded in Antsirabe, Madagascar, in 2021 by Eline Rodvelt Hansen and her husband Dina Rasalina Andriamanalina. The MMF story began in 2018 when Eline brought two fiddles to Madagascar with passion and hope. While studying fiddle at the Grieg Academy in Bergen, she dreamed of teaching children who lacked opportunities to develop their talents. Her dream became to establish a music school for the poorest children in Madagascar.

introduction.title: Let’s get to know each other
introduction.description: Music Changes Lives is a music school for vulnerable youth communities in Antsirabe, Madagascar, founded in January 2021 by Norwegian violinist Eline Rodvelt Hansen and Malagasy artist Dina Rasalina. The school is an active and supportive community that offers not only music and art lessons but also supports children from the poorest families in Antsirabe with food, healthcare, school supplies, clothing, and shelter.

introduction.title: Holistic learning and support
introduction.description: Music lessons are not just about learning an instrument. For our students, the music school becomes a safe haven — a place of equality and belonging, nurtured by teachers and fellow students. The power of education and a strong sense of community has drawn many street children, previously subjected to neglect and abuse, into a safe, inspiring learning environment. This fosters a sense of purpose, self-worth, and the possibility of transforming their lives through learning.

introduction.title: Empowerment through education
introduction.description: Many of our students had never attended school before. Our MMF teachers provide extra academic support for children struggling with their studies — a project that has shown significant improvement in development, learning, and child protection. With academic support after music lessons, children who once couldn’t read or write are now showing impressive academic and social progress. We place special importance on girls' education and gender equality, aiming to empower girls through music and general education so they can make better, more informed decisions about their lives.

introduction.title: Sustainable Growth and Community impact
introduction.description: By offering a safe, caring, and supportive environment, we have witnessed how young girls and women inspire their families to adopt healthier and more sustainable lifestyles. This creates a visible intergenerational change, proving that education holds the power to drive transformation — motivating us to continue working with dedication, love, and commitment. Since 2021, Music Changes Lives has been registered as an NGO with an independent board, supporting over 60 children. As we expand our educational capacity, we are proud to collaborate with local music teachers and create new jobs for the community.

introduction.title: Support and future goals
introduction.description: Our teachers offer lessons on traditional Malagasy instruments, percussion, dance and singing, classical guitar, double bass, visual arts, music theory, and chamber music — alongside violin, viola, cello, and piano. We also aim to introduce flute and clarinet lessons by 2022.

conclusion.title: Conclusion: A Model for Change
conclusion.description: When we see the remarkable transformation brought by our projects within the local community, we hope to inspire our students to become independent, responsible, and skilled individuals who contribute to positive regional development.

ourWork._comment: Our Work section - comment will be deleted later
ourWork.title: Our Work
ourWork.description: In Madagascar, child mortality is high, and many children die from diseases that could be easily treated with modern medicine. Common causes include infectious diseases such as respiratory infections, fever, gastrointestinal illnesses, and malaria. Madagascar also has one of the highest rates of malaria in the world, alongside other epidemics and pandemics that have been eradicated in other countries. Many people must travel long distances to reach the nearest clinic or hospital, and medical costs are expensive. As a result, they often delay seeking help until it is too late. Many of the children we meet on the streets suffer from serious health problems, and a large number of them endure severe malnutrition.

topics.title: Healthcare
topics.description: In Madagascar, child mortality is high and many die from diseases that can be easily treated with modern medicine. Typical causes are infectious diseases such as pneumonia, tuberculosis, diarrheal diseases and malaria. The country also has one of the highest incidences of plague in the world, as well as epidemics and pandemics that have otherwise been fought in other countries. Many have a long way to the nearest clinic and/or hospital, and the costs are high. They therefore do not seek help until it is too late. Many of the children we meet on the streets often have major health challenges, and several suffer from severe malnutrition.

topics.title: Education
topics.description: Schooling gives children hope for the future. When children lack basic knowledge and skills, they have limited opportunities. Education helps break the cycle of poverty and is a vital tool in combating poverty. The main goal of MMF is for children to become independent adults with their own income in the future. Therefore, it is important to facilitate the success and well-being of children in school.

topics.title: Living Situation
topics.description: Many of the children we enroll as students in MMF live on the streets when we first meet them. The reason they live on the streets is poverty. These children are left to fend for themselves, and older children often take on the responsibility of caring for younger siblings. Life on the streets is extremely tough, and every day is a struggle for survival. During the day, children spend a lot of energy begging for money and searching for food. As night falls, it's important to find a safe place to sleep for the night. Nights can be cold and dangerous, and the children huddle together to keep warm.

topics.title: Food Distribution
topics.description: Despite Madagascar being known for its lush climate, the country has been affected by natural disasters and the worst drought in decades, attributed to climate change. This has resulted in crop failure, leading to food crises and famine. Parents struggle to provide enough food and clean water for their children. When families cannot feed their children, sending them out to beg becomes the only option for survival. Children living on the streets spend a lot of time and energy searching for food scraps and often have to resort to scavenging through others' garbage.

topics.title: Music Lessons
topics.description: Meeting basic needs is crucial, but we also recognize that children need more. They need motivation, inspiration, joy, something to aspire to, new thoughts, and a belief that something else is possible. This brings us to the essence of the project: music. Studies show that when listening to and learning new music, new brain cells and connections are created. Research also shows that music enhances memory. Parents in MMF observe that their children perform better in school after they start playing an instrument. Collaboration is also particularly valuable, teaching children to cooperate, listen to each other, and express themselves.

topics.title: Future Goals
topics.description: One of our goals is to make MMF larger and more well-known so that we can include more children living tough lives on the streets. The main goal is for all children in Antsirabe to have enough food, clothing, experience care, have a safe and good home, attend school, and have the opportunity to develop their talents. It is important for us that the assistance we provide contributes to independence. The goal is for children to attend school and develop their talents so that one day they will become assets in their own communities, find employment, and stand on their own feet.

topics.title: Activities
topics.description: Children growing up in poverty in Antsirabe often have significant responsibilities from a very young age. They take care of younger siblings, cook meals, and are tasked with earning money for the family through begging. Sometimes, children are also assigned physically demanding tasks such as carrying sacks of rice or pushing heavy water cans, receiving little to no pay for their work. Entrusting adults with the responsibility of caring for their own children is an important part of our work. Children should get to be children! Therefore, play is an essential part of everyday life at MMF.

staff._comment: Section Our Staff Overview: This comment will be deleted later ( needs translation to malagasy )
staff.title: Our Staff

members.name: Eline Rodvelt Hansen
members.description: Eline is a violinist and violin teacher, educated at the Grieg Academy in Bergen. Originally from Sandnes in Rogaland, she has traveled extensively around the world, playing with musicians on several continents and in various genres.

members.name: Dina Rasalina Andriamanalina
members.description: Dina co-founded MMF with his wife, Eline Rodvelt Hansen, in 2021. Originally from Antsirabe, Madagascar, Dina has rhythm and music in his blood, having played many instruments since childhood. However, it was eventually the piano that became his dominant instrument.

members.name: Karoline Hartvigsen
members.description: Karoline completed her nursing education in 2017 and now works full-time at a cancer ward at Radiumhospitalet in Oslo. Before her bachelor's studies, she completed a one-year study in intercultural understanding at NLA University College Bergen.

members.name: Thea Harbo
members.description: Thea completed her bachelor's degree in nursing in 2017 at Diakonova University College in Oslo. She lived there for 9 years before moving back to her hometown, Stavanger. She has work experience from home nursing care, several years in a pediatric ward at Rikshospitalet.

staffDetails._comment: Section Detailed Staff Page: This comment will be deleted later ( needs translation to malagasy )
staffDetails.title: Our Staff

members.name: Eline Rodvelt Hansen
members.description: Eline is a violinist and violin teacher, educated at the Grieg Academy in Bergen. Originally from Sandnes in Rogaland, she has traveled extensively around the world, playing with musicians on several continents and in various genres. Additionally, she is a dedicated violin teacher. With two violins, she went to Madagascar with a desire to start a music school to help children out of poverty. In Antsirabe, she met her husband, Dina, who was also a musician and shared a similar dream. Together, they founded MMF in 2021 and now lead the work together. In addition, Eline works as a violin teacher at the music school, and she follows up ensembles and students on several instruments. Eline is also the leader of the Norwegian board of MMF.

members.name: Dina Rasalina Andriamanalina
members.description: Dina co-founded MMF with his wife, Eline Rodvelt Hansen, in 2021. Originally from Antsirabe, Madagascar, Dina has rhythm and music in his blood, having played many instruments since childhood. However, it was eventually the piano that became his dominant instrument. In London, he studied music technology and eventually worked in a music studio. With enthusiasm for children and development work, he returned to Madagascar, where he has been, among other roles, a project manager for international aid projects. He now leads the work of MMF alongside Eline, in addition to teaching piano and traditional Malagasy music and dance in the project.

members.name: Karoline Hartvigsen
members.description: Karoline completed her nursing education in 2017 and now works full-time at a cancer ward at Radiumhospitalet in Oslo. Before her bachelor's studies, she completed a one-year study in intercultural understanding at NLA University College Bergen. In connection with this, she traveled to Bolivia to conduct fieldwork at an orphanage focusing on the children's quality of life. Karoline has always had a great interest and commitment to humanitarian work and has volunteered as a nurse at a public hospital in Madagascar alongside Thea. She is now the deputy leader of the Norwegian board of MMF and helps coordinate the work done from Norway.

members.name: Thea Harbo
members.description: Thea completed her bachelor's degree in nursing in 2017 at Diakonova University College in Oslo. She lived there for 9 years before moving back to her hometown, Stavanger. She has work experience from home nursing care, several years in a pediatric ward at Rikshospitalet, and currently works full-time in a specially adapted department in a kindergarten. She has extensive experience working with children and enjoys it. Thea is a board member of MMF and is responsible for the finances of the project. She volunteers for the project and is responsible for the work carried out in Norway.

volunteer._comment: Section Volunteer: This comment will be deleted later ( needs translation to malagasy )
volunteer.title: Volunteer
volunteer.description: Would you like to make a difference for street children in one of the world's poorest countries? We are looking for individuals who want to volunteer with us in Madagascar. Primarily, we are seeking those with an interest in or education related to music. We find that students greatly benefit from instruction by professional musicians.

supportUs._comment: Section Support Us: This comment will be deleted later ( needs translation to malagasy )
supportUs.title: Support Us
supportUs.description: The funds that come in go towards covering everything from food, clothing, education, equipment, healthcare, medicines, and dental care for the children, as well as the operation of the music school and salaries for our staff. The families of the children are also included in the food program and receive monthly distributions of food.

latestNews._comment: Section Latest News: This comment will be deleted later ( needs translation to malagasy )
latestNews.title: Latest News

posts.title: MMF Culture and Arts Festival
posts.description: The MMF Culture and Arts Festival was a vibrant celebration of unity, showcasing the profound impact of music and art. Nestled in the picturesque city of Antsirabe, Madagascar, the event went beyond being just a festival; it was a heartfelt homage to the resilience, joy, and creativity of the children and communities we champion. The lively performances and art exhibitions ignited a sense of belonging, highlighting the blossoming talents within these communities. Through engaging workshops and collective projects, the festival offered a platform for attendees, particularly the youth, to unlock their creative capabilities.

posts.title: Stars Align for Madagascar at Paris Benefit Concert
posts.description: Last night, some of the world's most beloved musicians came together for a benefit concert, 'Voices for Madagascar,' to support the Music Changes Lives School. Held at the iconic La Seine Musicale, the event featured performances that spanned genres and generations, from classical to contemporary pop. The concert not only highlighted the universal language of music but also raised significant funds and awareness for music education in Madagascar. The event was a resounding success, with all proceeds going directly to the school, ensuring that music continues to change lives on the island.

posts.title: Malagasy Students Win Big at Youth Music Festival
posts.description: Students from the Music Changes Lives School in Madagascar took the world stage by storm at the International Youth Music Festival in Barcelona. Competing against young musicians from around the globe, the Malagasy contingent wowed audiences and judges alike with their skill, passion, and unique blend of traditional and modern musical influences. Their performances earned them several awards and international recognition, shining a spotlight on the talent being nurtured at the Music Changes Lives School and underscoring the importance of supporting music education worldwide.

posts.title: Music School Launches 'Melody Masters' App
posts.description: In a move to harness technology for education, the Music Changes Lives School has launched an innovative new app, 'Melody Masters,' designed to bring music education to students across Madagascar and beyond. The app combines interactive lessons, games, and virtual performances to make learning music accessible and fun for children everywhere, especially in remote areas with limited access to traditional music education. Developed in partnership with leading tech companies, 'Melody Masters' represents a significant step forward in the school's mission to make music education universally accessible, empowering students to explore their musical potential regardless of their circumstances.

upcomingEvents._comment: Section Upcoming Events: This comment will be deleted later ( needs translation to malagasy )
upcomingEvents.title: Upcoming Events

events.title: Back-to-School Fundraiser Gala
events.description: A sophisticated gala event to celebrate the beginning of the new school year, featuring student performances, a keynote speaker on the importance of music education, and a fundraising auction.

events.title: Run for Music 5k Charity Race
events.description: A fun and energetic 5K run where participants are encouraged to dress as their favorite musicians or music icons. Live bands along the route will keep the energy high.

events.title: Harmony Under the Stars
events.description: An enchanting outdoor concert featuring local and international artists, blending traditional Malagasy music with other world genres. Attendees will enjoy a night of musical diversity under the open sky.

events.title: Tunes and Taste Festival
events.description: A day-long festival celebrating the rich culture of Madagascar through its music, food, and arts. Includes live performances, food stalls, and workshops.

events.title: Voices for Education
events.description: A virtual concert live-streamed globally, featuring performances by renowned musicians and speeches by advocates for music education.

events.title: Rhythms of Hope Gala
events.description: An elegant evening event with a dinner, live music, and a silent auction of art and memorabilia, aimed at raising funds for scholarships and school improvements.

events.title: Holiday Giving Campaign
events.description: Launch a season of giving with a concert and community gathering. This event will feature holiday music from around the world and launch a campaign for donations of instruments and funds.

events.title: Music Marathon
events.description: A 12-hour music marathon where bands and solo artists perform non-stop. Audiences can come and go, with tickets sold at the door and proceeds going to the school.

events.title: Jam for Education
events.description: An interactive event where attendees participate in music workshops, jam sessions, and a large communal performance, showcasing the power of music to unite and educate.

events.title: Classic for a Cause
events.description: A classical music concert featuring local orchestras and choirs, with performances of both Western classical pieces and arrangements of traditional Malagasy songs.

events.title: Rock the School
events.description: A rock and pop concert aimed at a younger audience, with all proceeds going towards modernizing the school's music technology and equipment.

events.title: Jazz Nights
events.description: A series of jazz evenings held at various venues around the city, with local and international jazz musicians. Each night dedicated to a different jazz genre, supporting music education with style.

posts._comment: Section posts for MMF Culture and Arts Festival Post: This comment will be deleted later ( needs translation to malagasy )

topics.title: Celebrating the Heartbeat of Madagascar
topics.description: July 15, 2023, marked a day of vibrant celebration, unity, and the transformative power of music and art at the MMF Culture and Arts Festival. Held in the picturesque surroundings of Antsirabe, Madagascar, the festival was more than just an event; it was a testament to the resilience, joy, and creative spirit of the children and communities we serve.

topics.title: A Day to Remember
topics.description: From the early hours, the air buzzed with anticipation as visitors from near and far gathered, eager to immerse themselves in the rich tapestry of Malagasy culture. The festival kicked off with a traditional welcome dance, performed by the children of MMF, setting the tone for a day filled with laughter, music, and collective joy.

topics.title: A Symphony of Sights and Sounds
topics.description: The festival grounds came alive with a plethora of activities and performances. Stages showcased the talents of MMF students alongside local artists, each performance a story told through rhythm and melody. Workshops on traditional dance, crafts, and musical instruments offered hands-on experiences, bridging generations and cultures.

topics.title: Featuring local artists
topics.description: A highlight was the art exhibit, featuring works created by MMF students and local artists, illustrating their hopes, dreams, and the shared journey of growth and empowerment. The vibrant colors and intricate patterns spoke volumes of the talent and potential that thrives within the hearts of these young artists.

events._comment: Section events for the Back-to-School Fundraiser Gala Event: This comment will be deleted later ( needs translation to malagasy )

event_backToSchoolGala.title: Join Us for the Back-to-School Fundraiser Gala
event_backToSchoolGala.location: Location: Le Jardin Étoilé, Route Royale, Antananarivo, Madagascar
event_backToSchoolGala.description: As summer winds down and the anticipation of a new school year begins, Music Makes Futures (MMF) invites you to an evening filled with elegance, inspiration, and purpose. Mark your calendars for August 25, 2024, as we host our annual Back-to-School Fundraiser Gala at the prestigious Le Jardin Étoilé, Route Royale, Antananarivo, Madagascar. This gala isn't just an event; it's a celebration of hope, a testament to the power of education, and a night that promises to make a significant difference in the lives of children in Madagascar.

topics.title: Why Attend?
topics.description: The Back-to-School Fundraiser Gala is more than a gathering; it's a pivotal moment where you can directly impact the educational journey of countless children. Every ticket purchased, every auction item bid on, and every donation made during the gala will go directly towards supporting MMF's comprehensive education programs. From school supplies and tuition fees to teacher salaries and educational materials, your support will lay the foundation for a brighter, more promising future for the children we serve.

topics.title: What to Expect?
topics.description: Elegant Dining Experience: Enjoy a gourmet dinner prepared by some of the finest chefs in Madagascar, accompanied by a selection of exquisite wines and beverages. Silent Auction: Bid on an array of unique items and experiences, with all proceeds going directly towards our educational initiatives. Inspiring Speeches: Hear firsthand from the founders of MMF, educators, and the children whose lives you've touched, sharing stories of hope and triumph. Live Entertainment: The evening will feature breathtaking performances by MMF students, showcasing the talents nurtured through your support. Networking: Mingle with like-minded individuals, philanthropists, and community leaders who share your passion for making a difference.

topics.title: How Can You Support?
topics.description: Purchase a Ticket: Secure your spot at this unforgettable evening and be part of the change. Sponsor a Table: Gather friends, family, or colleagues for a special night out and amplify your impact. Donate: If you're unable to attend, consider making a donation to support MMF's mission. Every contribution, big or small, makes a difference. Volunteer: Lend your time and skills to make the gala a resounding success.

topics.title: Details at a Glance:
topics.description: Date: August 25, 2024, Time: 6:00 PM - 11:00 PM, Dress Code: Formal Attire, Tickets: [Link to purchase tickets or reservation details]

additionalInfo.paragraph: Your presence and support at the Back-to-School Fundraiser Gala will echo in the classrooms and futures of the children we serve. Together, we can ensure that education, the most powerful tool for change, is within their reach. For more information, to purchase tickets, or to make a donation, please visit MMF's website or contact us. We look forward to welcoming you to an evening of celebration, hope, and impact. Let's make this back-to-school season a turning point for children who dream of a brighter tomorrow. Music Makes Futures (MMF) - Transforming lives through the power of education and music. Join us, because every child deserves a chance to succeed.
